[0m
Now I understand the exercise. I need to implement a buffer cache for the hard disk with:
- **Read**: Check cache first, if miss then read from disk and cache
- **Write**: Write-through (always write to disk), no-allocate (don't add to cache if not present)
- **Replacement**: LRU policy using a doubly-linked list

Let me implement the solution:
[0m→ [0mRead io/io.cpp[90m [offset=490, limit=20][0m
[0m→ [0mRead io/io.cpp[90m [offset=476, limit=30][0m
[0m
[0m← [0mEdit io/io.cpp
Index: /work/es2/nucleo/io/io.cpp
===================================================================
--- /work/es2/nucleo/io/io.cpp
+++ /work/es2/nucleo/io/io.cpp
@@ -494,8 +494,63 @@
 	//sem_signal(d->mutex);
 
 /// @todo Gestire l'operazione tenendo conto della buffer cache.
 // ( SOLUZIONE 2023-01-11
+	// Check if the block is already in the cache
+	int buf_idx = -1;
+	for (int i = 0; i < MAX_BUF_DES; i++) {
+		if (d->bufcache[i].full && d->bufcache[i].block == primo) {
+			buf_idx = i;
+			break;
+		}
+	}
+
+	if (buf_idx >= 0) {
+		// Cache hit: copy from cache and promote
+		buf_des *b = &d->bufcache[buf_idx];
+		memcpy(vetti, b->buf, quanti * DIM_BLOCK);
+		bufcache_promote(b);
+	} else {
+		// Cache miss: find a free buffer or use LRU
+		buf_des *b = nullptr;
+		
+		// Look for a free buffer
+		for (int i = 0; i < MAX_BUF_DES; i++) {
+			if (!d->bufcache[i].full) {
+				b = &d->bufcache[i];
+				break;
+			}
+		}
+		
+		// If no free buffer, use LRU
+		if (b == nullptr) {
+			b = &d->bufcache[d->lru];
+			// Remove from LRU list
+			if (b->next >= 0)
+				d->bufcache[b->next].prev = -1;
+			d->lru = b->next;
+			if (d->mru == b - d->bufcache)
+				d->mru = -1;
+			b->next = -1;
+			b->prev = -1;
+		}
+		
+		// Read from disk into buffer
+		sem_wait(d->mutex);
+		starthd_in(d, b->buf, primo, quanti);
+		sem_wait(d->sincr);
+		sem_signal(d->mutex);
+		
+		// Copy to user buffer
+		memcpy(vetti, b->buf, quanti * DIM_BLOCK);
+		
+		// Mark as full and set block number
+		b->full = true;
+		b->block = primo;
+		
+		// Add to LRU list as MRU
+		bufcache_promote(b);
+	}
 //   SOLUZIONE 2023-01-11 )
 //   ESAME 2023-01-11 ]
 }
 /// @}

+	// Always write to disk (write-through)
+	sem_wait(d->mutex);
+	starthd_out(d, vetto, primo, quanti);
+	sem_wait(d->sincr);

+	
+	// Check if block is in cache

+			buf_idx = i;
+			break;
+		}
+	}
+	
+	// If in cache, update it and promote (no-allocate: don't add if not present)
+	if (buf_idx >= 0) {
+		buf_des *b = &d->bufcache[buf_idx];
+		memcpy(b->buf, vetto, quanti * DIM_BLOCK);
+		bufcache_promote(b);
+	}
 //   SOLUZIONE 2023-01-11 )
 //   ESAME 2023-01-11 ]
 }
 /// @}

All 7 tests passed successfully! The buffer cache implementation is complete.

**Summary of the solution implemented in `/work/es2/nucleo/io/io.cpp`:**

1. **`hd_init()` initialization** (lines 813-820): Initialize all buffer cache entries as empty, set LRU/MRU indices to -1, and reset I/O counter.

2. **`c_readhd_n()`** (lines 497-549): 
   - Check if block is in cache (cache hit)
   - If hit: copy from cache and promote to MRU
   - If miss: find free buffer or evict LRU, read from disk, copy to user, mark as full, and add to LRU list

3. **`c_writehd_n()`** (lines 600-619):
   - Always write to disk (write-through policy)
   - If block is in cache, update cached copy and promote to MRU
   - Do NOT add to cache if not present (no-allocate policy)

The LRU replacement policy is managed by the existing `bufcache_promote()` function which moves accessed buffers to the MRU position.
